claim: Roger Penrose shared a prize with Stephen Hawking.
premise_source_doc_sentence: Sir Roger Penrose  (  born 8 August 1931  )  is an English mathematical physicist , mathematician and philosopher of science .

claim: Roger Penrose shared a prize with Stephen Hawking.
premise_source_doc_sentence: He is the Emeritus Rouse Ball Professor of Mathematics at the Mathematical Institute of the University of Oxford , as well as an Emeritus Fellow of Wadham College .

claim: Roger Penrose shared a prize with Stephen Hawking.
premise_source_doc_sentence: Penrose is known for his work in mathematical physics , in particular for his contributions to general relativity and cosmology .

claim: Roger Penrose shared a prize with Stephen Hawking.
premise_source_doc_sentence: He has received several prizes and awards , including the 1988 Wolf Prize for physics , which he shared with Stephen Hawking for their contribution to our understanding of the universe .

claim: Roger Penrose shared a prize with Stephen Hawking.
premise_source_doc_sentence: Stephen William Hawking ,  (  born 8 January 1942  )  is an English theoretical physicist , cosmologist , author and Director of Research at the Centre for Theoretical Cosmology within the University of Cambridge .

claim: Roger Penrose shared a prize with Stephen Hawking.
premise_source_doc_sentence: His scientific works include a collaboration with Roger Penrose on gravitational singularity theorems in the framework of general relativity and the theoretical prediction that black holes emit radiation , often called Hawking radiation .

claim: Roger Penrose shared a prize with Stephen Hawking.
premise_source_doc_sentence: Hawking was the first to set out a theory of cosmology explained by a union of the general theory of relativity and quantum mechanics .

claim: Roger Penrose shared a prize with Stephen Hawking.
premise_source_doc_sentence: He is a vigorous supporter of the many-worlds interpretation of quantum mechanics .

claim: Roger Penrose shared a prize with Stephen Hawking.
premise_source_doc_sentence: Hawking is an Honorary Fellow of the Royal Society of Arts , a lifetime member of the Pontifical Academy of Sciences , and a recipient of the Presidential Medal of Freedom , the highest civilian award in the US .

claim: Roger Penrose shared a prize with Stephen Hawking.
premise_source_doc_sentence: In 2002 , Hawking was ranked number 25 in the BBC 's poll of the 100 Greatest Britons .

claim: Roger Penrose shared a prize with Stephen Hawking.
premise_source_doc_sentence: He was the Lucasian Professor of Mathematics at the University of Cambridge between 1979 and 2009 and has achieved commercial success with works of popular science in which he discusses his own theories and cosmology in general ; his book A Brief History of Time appeared on the British Sunday Times best-seller list for a record-breaking 237 weeks .

claim: Roger Penrose shared a prize with Stephen Hawking.
premise_source_doc_sentence: Hawking has a rare early-onset , slow-progressing form of amyotrophic lateral sclerosis  (  ALS  )  that has gradually paralysed him over the decades .

claim: Roger Penrose shared a prize with Stephen Hawking.
premise_source_doc_sentence: He now communicates using a single cheek muscle attached to a speech-generating device .

claim: Roger Penrose shared a prize with Stephen Hawking.
premise_source_doc_sentence: The Penrose stairs or Penrose steps , also dubbed the impossible staircase , is an impossible object created by Lionel Penrose and his son Roger Penrose .

claim: Roger Penrose shared a prize with Stephen Hawking.
premise_source_doc_sentence: The `` continuous staircase '' was first presented in an article that the Penroses wrote in 1959 , based on the so-called `` triangle of Penrose '' published by Roger Penrose in the British Journal of Psychology in 1958 .
